page.title: 12Halesowen Police Station
page.content: Halesowen Police Station was built 12 years ago to replace the old building. It has the only police driving school in the whole of the West Midlands. The constables take a gruelling test after ten weeks. They also have pounds for stray animals which are picked up by the R.S.P.C.A. within 24 hours if the owners have not claimed them. They also train thirty police dogs and handlers which takes ten weeks. There are 125 police in the station and about 12 are women. Prisoners can be taken straight to the magistrates court through a tunnel which links it to the station. The police can only be identified by identification cards and numbers. Community Crimewatch groups have been formed to watch for any signs of trouble and report this to the police.
